Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hatty5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff were very helpful and the breakfast was really good. Excellent location, close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Senatus last month on our first visit to Turkey. We found it to be very nice overall, and any of the quirks we ran into were easy to disregard. The staff was nice and helpful, especially the woman with long blond hair. The rooms were well maintained, modern and clean-- with regular cleaning and the staff was responsive to requests. The breakfast buffet was fine, but not great. Sure, you found some items gone if you came down too late, but I'm afraid this is par for the course in many places. Hotel was located on the main street in Sultanahmet. Overall I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - excellent service, close to blue mosque, we'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GoyoRico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first visit to Instanbul, couple with 7 year old child. We travel in Europe and Asia extensively and know what to expect. We appreciate service and are able to look past some small details, not needed here. Great choice, will stay here on our next trip. The staff were so helpful and accommodating. They took such great care of everything for us. We selected the gold package at time of booking and it included airport transfer and dinner at Palato Cafe, located in the hotel. This was a great choice for us, no worries on arrival and enjoyed a delicious meal. The rooms are clean and well equipped, a good value. While you can certainly spend more for lodging in Istanbul, this is a great balance for price and personal touch of service.

Reviews.Title: “first visit, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: nadoc0
Reviews.Content: very stylish, great decor, perfect room layout, excellent shower. complimentary tea, coffee and water. The staff are really very helpful. the location is excellent, near aya sofia, blue mosque, topkapi and just 5 mins walking from sultanahmet tram station. just loved the area and i recommend this hotel for those who are seeking relaxation. the street is surrounded by restaurants and cafes and for sure hotels and all you might need

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel/ Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Senatus Hotel over the Easter break. Pros: The hotel is well located in the Sultanahmed area. The Topkapi palce is few minutes walkaway. The hotel is very modern and extremely clean. The beds are comfortable with a extra pillows. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and professional. Cons: The minus side was that I was in a room 304 that was next to restaurant. The wall between room and kitchen is very thin and you can hear everything. You cannot sleep until the restaurant closes at 1.30am. I had my earplucks and was extremely tired on my first night, but the noise woke me up 4 times. It is not just tables and plates moving, but proper banging noises. I suggest this room for travelers who are nearly deaf or someoene who wants to go sleep after 1.30am. During the other times hte hotel was really quiet. Also there were problems with the breakfast and many other hotel guests complained about it. There was always some food that had run out, whether is was bread, juice, water etc..and the food was not replaced once it run out. The staff was not concerned about this and it took 15 -20 minutes to get juice or bread. It was a total joke. The staff was uninterested helping you and to get more food you had to request this for numerous times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Luciana V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Senatus Hotel for four days in February 2012. I can say that the service is excellent, the room has a wonderful bed (and I stayed in the standard room). Moreover, I forgot some great amount of money in the room, and just realized at the end of the day, when I returned and saw all the notes in the bed table. So, honest staff! The clerk Selcuk also made his best for us to have a plesant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Old Town attractions”
Reviews.Author: mjackson33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great area of restaurants (touristy though) and within minutes of the top sights in Istanbul. Staff was friendly. The bed was slightly too hard and I woke up with a stiff back most days. Room and bathroom were clean and bright. Bedrooms included mini bar fridge, bathrobes, and slippers. Internet worked great. I enjoyed going out in the morning and being close enough to come back in the afternoons for a break and then go out for the evening. We stayed for 4 days and it was a pleasant stay all around. Airport transportation can be arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AegeanGuides
Reviews.Content: I am the author of the 'A to Z Guides to the Greek Islands' and for 2012 we decided to offer our readers a quality trip to Istanbul from the Greek island of Thassos. We searched the available hotels in the Sultanahmet district (as this is the best placed area to visit the main Istanbul tourist attractions) and could find none with better reviews than the Senatus. We then visited Istanbul to complete our plans and stayed at the hotel to finally confirm our choice of base. Our short stay at the hotel was everything we had wished for. The rooms are fresh, clean and tastefully decorated, the staff extremely friendly and the position of the hotel in Istanbul is perfect. Breakfasts and meals were of high quality and well served. I therefore was amazed to read the recent review by 'Rogers222'! My only comment is that there are some people who you can never please!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff so helpful .....”
Reviews.Author: JPS_in_WGS
Reviews.Content: they walked a friend of ours to their hotel after drinks and dinner with us as they weren't 100% sure of the way back. Room was fine - one of the standard rooms, Lovely big shower and enough room to spread out into on our 3 day break! Breakfast was nice and they will do fresh eggs if you ask and coffee very nice way to start the day (much needed as so cold when we were there!) Location is great - so close to Blue Mosque and all the main tourist areas

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, great reception, great help....just great”
Reviews.Author: 789malta
Reviews.Content: This hotel really made our trip to Istanbul so much better than it already was...the reception as well as all the employees were great....we managed to get a cheaper rate on 3 rooms simply because we stayed in the bottom floor which was really comfortable because the rooms are super, connecting and we had the whole floor to ourselves.....honestly i highly recommend it. very central, walking distance to all the sights and the street itself is a very safe with a charming atmosphere to it.

Reviews.Title: “Just an Overpriced Hostel”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: Positive: good neighborhood, close to the Blue Mosque and other key tourist attractions. Although there are dozens of better hotels in the same neighborhood. Negative: Tiny, tiny, tiny room. The room contained a double bed with literally 50 cm of room space around the edges of the bed. No shelves, no drawers, no place to store luggage or stow clothing and other items. So you end up putting the luggage on the only available floor space and stepping on it to get to the bed or the bathroom. Folded clothes end up on the table, competiing with the teapot and computer for limited space. Cramped and uncomfortable for one or two guests. There are no/no convenient electrical sockets. There was a single one underneath the small table, so if you want to plug in your computer you have to crawl under the table and unplug the teapot. If you want to charge your cel phone, you have to do it in the bathroom. There are no electrical sockets near the night tables, so you can't plug in a clock or charge your cel phone by the bed. No shelves or cabinets in the bathroom. Not inside the shower, so you have to put your shampoo and soap on the floor while you shower. Not near the sink, so you have no place to put your toiletries. No hooks or shelves to hang towels or clothing. You have to toss it all on the floor. The glass bathroom door is about 2 feet from the bed, so people in the bathroom and bedroom have no privacy between them. The reception desk is staffed by a couple of teenagers who are so busy surfing the internet that they don't lift their heads to greet guests. Breakfast is included, but mediocre. Cold cuts, powdered juice and bread. This hotel is only a couple of years old, so the paint and decorations are new, but the rooms are so small and badly-furnished that it reminds me of a youth hostel, except that the price is that of a real hotel. Wouldn't recommend it, and wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Senatus hotel, part of a family!!”
Reviews.Author: Leona P
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the senatus hotel istanbul from the 9 january 2012 until the 17 january 2012. We loved it! The staff were all very helpful and excellent- in particular the man working at the front desk named selcuk, we cant possibly be grateful enough for all of the information and help we received. The Senatus is located in the popular and central location of sultanahmet. Easy walking distance to main attractions. The rooms at the senatus are spacious and clean and the price is very reasonable. Thank you again to everyone at the Senatus for making our trip so memorable, we will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rubio52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, could not fault it in any way at all. The staff were just adorable, we have been to a lot of hotels where the staff a â€œpleasantâ€� in an artificial way, we got the â€œfeelingâ€� it was all genuine, they just could not be more helpful and caring. Location and everything about the place we just could not fault. As we left for the airport early after breakfast 2 of the staff came out and waived us bon voyage with huge genuine smiles. Perfect and if we get back we would not look for anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Senatus Hotel - a wonderful respite in the midst of everything”
Reviews.Author: KenaiAlaska
Reviews.Content: Senatus Hotel is located near many of the tourist attractions of Istanbul. It was great to walk every day between the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya (Haghia Sophia) on the way to the tram stop. However, the location was not in a tourist ghetto, as I had feared that it might be, and we were very happy we chose to stay here rather than, for example, at Taksim Square. The staff was very friendly, and exceedingly helpful. The morning breakfast was good, and the staff at the restaurant very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable :)”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there end of December 2011, staff, cleanness, location and service is out of question. freely upgraded the room to a greater one with Jacuzzi, Super comfy king bed and 40" screen overlooking a wonderful street view. Got free dinner, free drinks, sauna access, airport transfer and full support from their lovely staff. you have to try it if you want to stay in the old city close to the historical area... it's unique.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Extremely”
Reviews.Author: Ä±zabele c
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful,location is very near to central,comfortable room,clean and pleasant,we enjoyed our time,thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kuklisd
Reviews.Content: A total of five of us just spent 4 nights at this gem of a hotel and loved everything about it. Besides being in a great location in the old city to all of the sites and located on a street with many wonderful bars and restaurants, the best thing about this hotel is the fabulous staff. Everybody at this hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome and always went the extra mile to do whatever they could. We were particularly impressed with Selcuk who helped us with everything from restaurant reservations to doing research for us as to when museums and others places were open. In a city where the people are incredibly helpful and friendly Selcuk really stood out. We look forward to our next trip to Istanbul and staying at the Senatus.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: Concierge34
Reviews.Content: I had a very good time in their restaurant. While having my dinner I met Mr. Umut Germeyan who is the Gm of Senatus. He invited me to the hotel section and walked around checked their rooms. Compared to the other ones in AkbÄ±yÄ±k Street, I was very impressed with the rooms. I noticed that there are young people staying there. If you are searching a very nice, clean, little bit luxury and located in the hearth of Old Town, try it..

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Daveenjoysretirement
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senatus for 4 nights celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. It is a very comfortable boutique hotel in the centre of the old townn The staff were all very friendly in particular Selcuk who organised numerous trips and restaurantsfor us. Should I return to Istanbul I would definitely stay at the Senatus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and staff in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Margaret069
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from my visit to Turkey I wanted to tell you how much I enjoyed both my stays at the Senatus Hotel on Oct. 5 -6 and Oct. 19th . The location is ideal for exploring the old city with its many sights and monuments. There were numerous shops and restaurants nearby including small convenience stores. The facilities were very extremely comfortable and clean and I enjoyed dining in the restaurant for both breakfast and lunch. I especially enjoyed having the mini-fridge and kettle in the room! The beds and pillows were very, very comfortable and ensured an excellent night's sleep. The decor was just right - modern, fresh and relaxing. What made the stay even more enjoyable was your staff, especially the two gentlemen on the front desk. Both were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. They could not have been friendlier and I felt they took very good care of us. Their assistance with transfers, restaurant suggestions, maps, internet access, sending faxes and airline check in was of immense value. I travel a great deal internationally and I donâ€™t often find the level of service offered by the Senatus. I hope that one day soon I will be able to return.

Reviews.Title: “A good one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnKWHo
Reviews.Content: Due to an over-booking at the hotel I booked, my wife and I were assigned to this hotel which was two units away. This hotel is situated about 5mins from both the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Mosque). 10mins walk will get you to the Sultanahmet tram stop which will get you to most other sites in Istanbul. The hotel is on a cozy street filled with other boutique hotels, restaurants and travel agencies; access is convenient. The hotel has about 16 rooms (I may be wrong but that's about the number) on 4 floors. It has a small lift that will fit 2 persons and luggage conveniently. The room we were assigned was the smallest of the pick in the hotel. Had a queen size bed and was pretty tight as far as space was concerned. However, the hotel is almost brand new and everything was working well, clean and functional. The toilet reminded me of those that I find in cheaper hotels in Tokyo i.e. small. So if you are claustrophobic, please make sure you get one of their larger rooms. There is no great views from this hotel. We ate 2 breakfast there, both good. It can't compete with the buffets of the large hotels but it's has enough of a spread to keep you filled for a day of sight-seeing. The staff were nice and courteous at all times but did not have the warmth we experienced in other boutique hotels but then again, we stayed only one night and it is unfair of me to judge them on that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Senatus!”
Reviews.Author: SmallieG
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul after a 12 night cruise and stayed at the Senatus Hotel. Lovely place, with just really lovely people in the restaurant who serve you during your breakfast buffet. The hotel itself is in a great location with plenty of restaurants, and very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and Topkapi. The rooms are modern, we lucked out and booked a standard room but they gave us a deluxe room with a super king bed and a view of the street below. Would definitely go back! My parents who were with us who stayed at 3 different hotels while in Istanbul said that they would go back and stay at Senatus! Oh, the bed was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Bluerobin59
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Istanbul .Stayed with three other couples, family members ,for four nights loved the way staff went out of their way to accomodate and make your stay enjoyable. The food in the restaurant was so good we ate there twice which given the number of local restaurants is a mark of how good it was.The hotel has style and a great ambiance.It is well located for all the sights and we would definitely stay again. Got free meals and drinks for internet booking which was good.There is an attention to detail which makes it special . Dressing robes and slippers, loofas, and candles in the room.Great coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eatandrun33
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to Istanbul. We were welcomed at the airport by the Senatus Hotel Driver who was dressed in suit and tie, drove a spacious and spottelss Mercedes mini-van and was extremely professional. Upon arrival at the hotel, the staff were also very welcoming and were kind enough to upgrade our room. I would definitely recommend staying in a deluxe room if there is one available. The hotel is in a fantastic location in a picturesque part of town on a busy street full of resturants and bars in the old city. Our room had big windows overlooking the activity on the street. The room itself was spotlessly clean and very spacious and modern. The room had everything we needed including tea and coffee, minibar, flatscreen tv, bathroom extras incuding "Dove" shower products, robes and slippers, there were also a few fabulous books on Istabul and it's food, for you to read, available to purchase if you wanted to take them with you. The location of the hotel is such that if you stay here, you would not have to pay for any of the usual tours because all the major attractions are within walking distance and the light rail is also less than 10 minutes walk. The bed and pillows were undoubtably one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in. The hospitality was sincere and warm and if it wasn't for the boys, we would have left for the airport without all our credit cards and passports which we had stupidly left in our room. The boys were always there to assist or recommend. Thank you for a wonderful stay in Istanbul, it was without a doubt one of the best holidays we've EVER had. So much fun and such lovely people. We feel very lucky that we were able to stay here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it and hopefully one day, return. As a tip, we booked the airport transfers through the hotel, both to and from the airport. This made everything so easy - definitely a must.

Reviews.Title: “best and romantic”
Reviews.Author: bestundfest
Reviews.Content: my wife and I never stayed any hotel like senatus. its incredible... staff is realy friendly. we will stay again and again because my wife loved senatus... thank you seljuk and gurkem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place #2”
Reviews.Author: seadog17
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get back into the Ottoman Park Hotel on return to Istanbul so I picked the Senatus Hotel from TA. What a great choice. Less expensive and room a bit smaller than the Ottoman. Actually had a better location for touristing. Less hill climbing. Once again, a great staff, from the late check-in to the obliging service people at breakfast. Had back quiet room and stealth housekeeping. Really enjoyed our two days here and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with 5 star Service”
Reviews.Author: Brandonfel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days in October. Let me be being by saying that the rooms look like the pictures on the website. The decor is fine, but what really makes this hotel stand out is it staff and location. 1) The hotel is located in the historical center of Istanbul. Therefore you are within walking distant of the major tourist attractions. 2) The hotel is located near the metro; therefore if you want to see the rest of Istanbul you have easy access to public transportation. 3) The staff is the best part of the hotel. The go above and beyond expectation. I was constantly surprised at the length they went to in-order to make my staff pleasure able. Of course they like all hotels provide you with tourist maps and info, but they also help in ways you would not expect. Upon check-in they upgrade me, because they said an upgraded room was available. Second, on my third day, I did not have any cash and the hotel loan me the equivalent of 50USD. Third, they made dinner reservation. The last thing they did was completely unexpected. When I checked out and left my bags at the hotel because my flight did not leave until 9 pm. When I checked out I left my camera charger plugged into a plug underneath the desk. Upon cleaning the room house charger, and placed it in my bag. They left a note saying we found your charger and placed it in your bag. Every request I made the hotel really tried to fulfill. I really felt like a guess. I booked through the hotels website, and so I got a free three course dinner for two. Breakfast is also included for free. The rooms are nice, but the service is excellent and location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern interior, great location”
Reviews.Author: KarlienH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Senaturs for 4 nights in October. Fantastic location, within walking distance from most of the main sites and close to the main tramline. Modern decor, simple but chic. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room + bath robe and slippers. Excellent service, all staff are very helpful with any queries you might have. Located on a 'touristy' street but I think you would always get that with a good location. We had a room at the back and it was outside high season so there wasn't any noise at night. The street is full of hotels/bar/restaurants and you don't really get a 'Turkish feel' but that's not to say that some of the bars an restaurant aren't great (Metropolis Restaurant across the road was excellent). The breakfast buffet at the hotel was varied with something to please anyone - continental cheeses and meats, eggs, fruit, yoghurt, bread, croissants, pain au chocolat etc. The restaurant attached to the hotel is not too bad either, we got a complimentary meal on arrival which was a nice surprise. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Make sure you pay for transfer as well as Istanbul traffic is crazy at times and the airport is a fair trek. Not the cheapest hotel maybe, but you get what you pay for. The only slight disappointment was the extra charge to use the sauna, which we subsequently chose not to use. It would have been nice if that had been included.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tiggeroo1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Senatus having seen the good reviews on trip advisor - we were not disappointed. The hotel is on a small road of cafe's, bars and hotels just a few minutes from the Blue Mosque and other main attractions. The staff were very friendly and really helpful. The breakfast was brilliant, an amazing choice of hot and cold foods - probably one of the best buffet breakfasts we had in similar hotels abroad. We stayed in a standard room which was very comfortable, immaculately clean and suprisingly spacious for a boutique hotel. There was a fridge in the room stocked with wine/beer and soft drinks but there was room to store our own items too. We would definately recommend this hotel both for it's location and its relaxing atmoshere. A real gem - can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRickc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Senatus for four nights in September. Excellent location close to the the Blue Mosque and other main sites-allowing for early entry into tourist sites ahead of the cruise ship crowds. Service from the hotel staff was excellent, pointing out some great restaurants and places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel--wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: janeyotoroto
Reviews.Content: The Senatus hotel is a small gem, with beautifully designed rooms and nice touches, like shower slippers and bathrobes. But the best thing is the amazingly friendly and helpful staff who made our time in Istanbul a real treat. The location of the hotel is perfect, on a street in Sultanahmet filled with sidewalk cafes and restaurants, close to all the main historic sites and many rooftop restaurant/bars where you can watch the sun go down with a 360 view of the sea, the Blue Mosque, Beyoglu and the Hagia Sophia. It really doesn't get any better than this. The front desk staff Selcuk and Bagdas (sorry if I spelled your names wrong guys!) were really fun to talk to and would spend time each day planning an itinerary based on where you wanted to go and what to do. So, many thanks for all that help. The breakfast was included and was very good, with muesli, yoghurt, nice breads, cheeses and some meats. The servers in the restaurant couldn't have been better and they make a damn good cappuccino. So, all in all, I would stay here in a heartbeat if I am ever lucky enough to get back to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Grew To Like It!”
Reviews.Author: 5*Hotelreviewer
Reviews.Content: The Senatus is on a lively street packed with hotels, backpacker hostels, cafes and restaurants only 5 minutes from the major attractions. The entrance is a doorway between two restaurants which leads to a small reception area. We were greeted by an unshaven gentleman in shorts and tee shirt. Being used to smartly dressed hotel staff, I wondered if I had arrived at the right hotel but my mind was put at rest when were were shown the room (a standard) which looked the same as the photos on the hotel website. We asked for and were given a quiet room at the back of the hotel. Unfortunately this means no view & not much natural light as the next door block of flats is only a few meters away. The room also had a large pillar which had to be carefully navigated when getting in / out of bed. The room was very clean and well decorated. The bed was large but firm since the mattress rested on a platform. There was tea & coffee + in room safe. The robes and slippers were a nice, unexpected touch. The bathroom was small with a fantastic shower (no bath). Unfortunately it had my pet hate - a glass door between it and the bedroom. When using the bathroom at night the light floods the bedroom (disturbing the other occupant) and as the door doesn't closely fit the surround the sounds and smells(!) from the bathroom are noticeable in the bedroom. Breakfast in the restaurant was OK - nothing special & the staff were not especially attentive. We didn't have dinner there as the large screen TV put us off. The Albura restaurant next door is worth trying as it has an entrance (at the back on the right) to the recently discovered Grand Palace of Constantine. It's still being excavated but it well worth a visit. Also the nearby Four Seasons Hotel is expensive but an oasis of calm with fantastic views from the roof top terrace of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The hotel staff very helpfully checked us in online for our flight home and stored the luggage. Despite initial reservations, I grew to like the hotel. However, I'm not sure it warrants its very high Trip Advisor ranking (no 15 at time of writing) but then again, I'm judging it by hotels elsewhere that I've stayed in rather than Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Senatus....what a delight !!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCakal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is/was wonderful. I used tripadvisor.com to review comments from previous guests prior to booking. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly. I was surprised (and delighted) when our room was upgraded. The room was spotless, both bed & bath...nice wood floors. This is a lovely boutique hotel, which opened in February 2010. Located in Sultanahmet (Old City), it's on a street (& in a neighborhood) with many other hotels, but I'm SO HAPPY we chose the Senatus. It is close walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, shops, restaurants, etc..... There's also a metro stop within 5 mins. walk. Although in a touristy area, it's quaint & charming. They have a restaurant at street level, where we enjoyed outdoor dining for both meals (inside seating also available). We ate both breakfast, as well as dinner on our first night. Breakfast had many choices - asst. meats & cheeses, fresh fruits & juices, veggies (fresh tomatoes, olives), yogurt, asstd. breads & cereals, etc.... a nice way to begin the day !! Dinner the previous evening - grilled fish, vegetables, potatoes, shepherd salad, a great local wine & fresh fruit plate. The waitstaff was both friendly & attentive. Our waiter was presently attending English language school, so he enjoyed having the opportunity to practice a little. They also provided 3 different alternatives to reach the airport the next day. We also stayed at 2 other hotels in Istanbul, plus 3 others in Turkey during this trip.....the Senatus is/was THE BEST !!! P.S. Ours was a romantic room looking room......lovely bedspread, bathrobes folded on the bed, candles on the table/desk, nice offering of amenity products in the bath.....sorry it was such a short stay (1 night).....can't wait to return !

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Ellen R
Reviews.Content: The Senatus Hotel exceeded our expectation in location, hospitality, food and comfort. Selcuk, the front desk executive, was the main coordinator of our fabulous time in Istanbul. His attention to us in helping to coordinate our plans was invaluable. It felt like coming home each night to a caring family member.

Reviews.Title: “Tebrikler Senatus ...”
Reviews.Author: nevin t
Reviews.Content: EÅŸimle evlilik yÄ±ldÃ¶nÃ¼mÃ¼mÃ¼zde Ä°stanbul'da yasÄ±yor olmamÄ±za raÄŸmen Senatus Hotel'i secerek gÃ¼zel bir hafta sonu geÃ§irmeyi planladÄ±k ve gerÃ§ekten Ã¶yle oldu. KaldÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z Imperator oda ruya gibiydi, dekorasyonundan temizliÄŸine, detaylarÄ±ndan banyosundaki ihtiÅŸama kadar Sultanahmet'te belki de eÅŸine benzerine rastlanmayacak guzellikte bir oda. EmeÄŸi gecen herkese teÅŸekkur etmek istedik. Resepsiyon ekibi, kahvaltÄ± ekibi cok canayakÄ±n ve yardÄ±msever. Restoranda yediÄŸimiz akÅŸam yemeÄŸindeki hÃ¼nkar beÄŸedinin lezzetini ise unutmamÄ±z mumkun degil.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: daraius
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days over and after the F1 weekend. Lovely little boutique hotel, superb personalised service, unobtrusive, yet efficient. the guys at the desk were knowledgeable and helpful, and gave us a lot of usefil tips on getting around. Would definitely recomment it.

Reviews.Title: “We are definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: lynnouss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very stylish, great location, walking distance to all major attractions and tram stations, shops and restaurants... The staff , and I mean all of them are sloop friendly and helpful and generous with everything. Our room was not small, it was nice, our view wasn't nice but that's ok... The bed can be more comfortable however this is a minor thing. Great service, and great breakfast place with outside seating... If your a couple and want to stay in istabul I highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & friendly place, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nofsky82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Senatus with a friend and we had a nice time there. Hotel is located just a short walk away from all important sights (Hagia Sophia, etc.). Staff was really helpful, they really tried to help and answered all questions about places to go, transport, diner, etc. Breakfast was good, I would recommend to have it outside when the weather is nice. Room was stylish and clean but rather small and this is maybe the only negative comment about this place I can give. However, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AzharH
Reviews.Content: We (6 family members - 3 rooms) stayed 5 nights at the Senatus. Found it very conveniently located, literally under 10 walking minutes from the three main tourist attractions i.e Hagia Sofia, Topkapi and the Blue Mosque. The staff was most courteous and helpful, even allowed us a day room, without charge, to keep our luggage, wash up etc on the day of our departure which was at 10 pm. The tram station is also a very short walk away where one finds numerous restaurants and shops. Overall we all truly enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and we happily recommend the Senatus.

Reviews.Title: “When I will return to Istanbul I take this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bezpol-net
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. Clear. Room was nice and enough big for two. View from window was not perfect. Noise in hotel is small and not make a problem. Service in hotel perfect. Breakfasts in nine days not change always the same but good ! Localization for holidays in Istanbul perfect. Very close to everything intersting in city and 3 minutes to tram. Restaruant in the hotel very good and menu very appetatie.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: ShareKhan4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Senatus for 3 nights and were really happy with the experience. The room was comfortable and luxurious, the breakfast spread was good and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located near all the top old city attractions like Topkapi palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. There are plenty of bars and restaurants around and a tram stop is a short walk away. If we returned to Istanbul, we're definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: klavier_mann
Reviews.Content: It was the staff that really made our stay here special. Whether it was making arrangements for a restaurant, or recommendations for a tour, hotel staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is in the heart of Sultanahmet, a short walk away from key attractions such as the Hagia Sofiya and Blue Mosque. We enjoyed being in the center of things, but we could hear the buzz of the street from our room at night. We didn't find it loud enough to be a disturbance, but it might be quieter with a room away from the street. Rooms were well-appointed, clean and comfortable -- nice to come back to after a day of sightseeing or shopping. A small but adequate breakfast buffet was included in our rate Good value and an excellent base to explore this fascinating city. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, walking distance from sites”
Reviews.Author: tbootz
Reviews.Content: Excellent service upfront, for our specific needs, very kind and pleasant service and advise on what to do and where to eat, would go there again any time ! The rooms are very modern and clean, the people are very accomodative and provide the right tips on where to have an unforgettable dinner with a magnificent view. We all really enjoyed it, perfect price/quality in very good location, which was key for us. Tammo Bootz

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located and very helpful staf. Would definitely + recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelique f
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Modern. Good price/quality. Perfectly located for visting all touristic sites on walking distance. Staf is very helpful and friendly in the hotel but pe also for selecting nice restaurants!! We would definitely recommend and return during our next visit to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DianaCR
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel, located in Sultanahmet on a road teeming with fun bars and nice restaurants, some with terraces offering views of the Haiga Sophia, Blue Mosque and Bosphorous. Although this area is somewhat touristy and pricy, the hotel is only 200 meters from the Haiga Sophia, Blue Mosque etc. and both a tram stop and a metro stop giving you easy access to the rest of Istanbul. Despite the active nightlife in the surounding bars and restaurants, double glazing and thick walls mean that none of the nightlife interferes with a good nights sleep if you're staying in, and the aircon keeps the room fresh and cool. The room we stayed in (Dominus they term it) has a very comfy king sized bed, ensuite with an amazing large and powerful shower, jacuzzi bath that fits two, mini-bar, aircon and strong wifi with a fast interent connection. We stayed here for the second part of our honeymooon and the staff made sure we had an amazing week in this hotel: they are friendly and helpful, helping us to avoid being ripped off by the notorious Istanbul Taxis; to avoid some of the tourist traps characteristic of any big city; and passing on tips from previous visitors. This hotel is excellent for people looking for a romantic stay, or for exploring the old city of Istanbul, and when we come back (as you must to this amazing city) we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JamJul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Senatus for one night while passing through Istanbul. Efficient online booking, good airport meeting service and comfortable/clean room. In a very good location in Sultanahmet, on a road with plenty of restaurants and a short walk from the main tourist sites. I had to leave early in the morning to catch a plane, but coffee and breakfast offered before the normal serving time. Only minor negative comment is about the somewhat strange interior design in the common areas (but that is a matter of taste, not something that everybody will agree with)! All in all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you are visiting Istanbul for the first time, This hotel is the perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: walkingtheearth
Reviews.Content: Senatus Hotel excels in Customer Service, this is where it mostly shines. In the 21st Century Customer Service is what matter most to customers than how extravagant a hotel is. Gone are the days were marble flooring and Golden Door Knobs were enough to satisfy hotel customers, its all about the quality of service! From the day we booked our room Online, Senatus hotel communicated with us immediately by email confirming our booking and answering all our questions, they even went out of their way suggesting what we should tour before we even arrived. Airport transfer was hassle free, This hotel actually looks really nice from outside and inside, i believe its an old building that was overhauled with very nice finishing...we were greeted nicely by the reception staff, Check-in Was smooth, the room was ready on-time, while the room was not spacious (Economy) it was clean, nicely decorated + LCD TV (for when you can't fall asleep at night) and honestly the room is sufficient for any couple. As we spent 95% of the time outside the hotel, space didn't matter. The Washroom is very nice and we enjoyed the Rain Shower after a long day touring Istanbul. The staff are great, every staff member is very chilled out and its clear that they have a relaxed work atmosphere. The General Manager himself hangs around the hotel most of the time and they all wear the same T-shirts so you can't really tell who is who until you ask him, he's that humble! Staff is very helpful with all your needs and always say "Yes" to whatever you ask, never heard a "No", if something is difficult they will always "Try their best". They will also explain to you all the info you need and will never pressure to sell you "Tour packages" unless you want to opt for one. Breakfast was included in our package which was an added bonus (most other hotels were charging this separately) the breakfast is of good quality, but i do wish they provided more variety, the menu is fixed with eggs & sausage. Also the Music that played at breakfast was classical music, while relaxing it wouldve been nice to have a turkish version of "relaxing" music for a more authentic experience. Something unique i found is that they played "Tom & Jerry" every morning on TV (muted) which i enjoyed although many other reviewers complained of this on TA. We got a good deal on this hotel, considering the peak season we visited Istanbul in, we paid about 1000TL for 4 nights which was better than most nearby comparable hotels quoted me. Now to the negatives: There isn't really much to complain about, but as mentioned earlier the breakfast does need variety & authenticity. And its v difficult to get an early-Checkin & Late checkout especially on high season to this hotel, this is not really the hotel's fault due to limited number of rooms but it definitely would be nice to check in early especially if your flight comes in early in the day, or checkout late if your flight is late...An issue that you might not face in larger hotels. A very good Experience overall, if this is your first time in Istanbul look no further, don't confuse yourself looking for big brand hotels...you won't regret it. This hotel will offer you Good Service, good location (close to ALL the site seeing) and Good ambience.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the old city of Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: PatAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it is simply a real gem...the hotel is located walking distance from every tourist spots of the historic peninsula (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Cemberlitas Hammam, etc...)...the staff is very friendly and will help you around the clock with all the questions you may have on the destination...we recommend the deluxe room as it is a large room, decorated with style with a very nice four poster bed...great bedding and pillows , helping you to restore your energy after a busy day of visits and shopping...compliments to the General Manager of this boutique hotel , Mr Umut Germeyan who is doing a great job with his team...highly recommended...PM

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel...with a caveat!”
Reviews.Author: j_p_faranda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this perfectly-located hotel for 4 nights before moving to the nearby Four Seasons, so I have a ready standard for measurement. The staff is great...helpful and friendly. The location is superb. The restaurant is nice (as is the discount). Unlike the 4 Seasons, the Internet is free! And the rooms, unlike some reviews, are spotless. The only caveat is that I originally was given a room on Floor 1 (#101), which was incredibly tiny. As a solo traveler, I didn't mind that there wasn't room to leave my suitcase open. But when a couple moved in to the room next door, it was clear that the connecting door between the rooms was not insulated at all. In fact, the door does not even go all the way down to the floor, so you not only get sound, but light, too, under the door. I carried on conversations with my new neighbors without even raising my voice. When I complained to the front desk, I was told that they did not routinely rent these rooms individually but usually gave them to families. However, they were full that night, but agreed to move me to a larger room the next day without charge. Which they did and everything was superb after that. But, the caveat is that you may want to avoid the "economy" rooms and pay the extra 20 euros to ensure that you get a good room. You will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller191278
Reviews.Content: The Senatus Hotel in Istanbul is of an extremely high standard. It is small and has very friendly, helpful staff. The room we stayed in was clean, comfortable and beautifully tastefully decorated. We used the attached Palato restaurant, where the standard and variety of food on offer was also very high. We have recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for a weekend city break!”
Reviews.Author: petrina_k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for a city break. Within walking distance from the major attractions (Aghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi), and very convenient in terms of tram connections. The hotel is small and very pretty. Well decorated with a nice character. The staff are extremely professional; polite, helpful and descreat. We got a free upgrade as there was a availability. We stayed in a Dominus-type room that was very spacious, very pretty, very clean. The beds are big and soooo comfy! Great value for money. I would highly recommend this hotel to nayone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place,enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: mtmoretha495
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights,wonderful place we really enjoyed,the staff was incredibly helpful,the rooms were fun and modern yet comfortable.Overall this hotel was a treat and we will certainly stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique near the blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: Elisa_Chiu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Senatus Hotel for 3 nights during my first visit in Istanbul and would highly recommend this gem to others. Attached are some pics of this beautiful place and here are some highlights: * Superb location: Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Sarayi, Grand Bazzar and other major attractions are all within walking distance. We went back to the hotel during the day a couple of times to either recharge, rest a bit or pick up something because of the convenience of its proximity with the major sites. * The hotel is situated on a bustling street with nice restaurants and cute shisha places, but the windows are thick enough to ensure the quietness in the evening (I stayed on the 4th floor facing the street). * Staff are friendly, warm and helpful! * Super clean room with tasteful decoration. Best shower - super strong! * Breakfast is not fancy but with quality food. :") Croissant is surprisingly good. Great bread spread! Very reasonable price to stay with this lovely place. The only thing is that it doesn't have a rooftop restaurant with sea view / view of Blue Mosque etc.; however you can easily find such places around the hotel. We heart Senatus!

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Stalebi
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Senatus Hotel and enjoyed every aspect of it. It is superbly located, close to all the 'must-see' sites of Istanbul, and situated on a nice bustling, but quaint street with many restaurants and other boutique hotels. The room itself is clean (which was very important to us), and really wonderfully decorated. The breakfast was also very nice - a great variety of foods. Most importantly, the staff was incredibly helpful - any questions we had, they either had answers to or went the extra mile to find out the answer. On several occasions we inquired about restaurants to go to and the staff offered us directions, and called to make a reservation for us. We have absolutely no complaints and highly recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Gezinha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a walking distance to the main attractions in Sultanamet: Blue Mosque, Haya Sofia and Tokapy Palace. The street also is the point of many restaurants and other hotels. The hotel is new, the rooms are small but very clean and with nice furnished. The staff is so polite and always available to give you good tips for restaurants, transportation, sightseens and helpfull to book a table or a shuttle. There is a small and nice sauna on the basement. It worth a visit at the end of the day to get ready for the good recommendation of restaurant that they will propose for you. Also in the room are some amenities, 01 botle of water and staff to prepare your own coffee and tea. The breakfast is good, full of local options but also you can find eggs, sausages and other more western options. When booking this hotel, be in contact in advance and ask them to help you out with the transportation from the airport to the hotel and vice versa. Be aware you are in Turkey and there are business people everywhere offering you a price that later you realize was not so good. We contracted the shuttle in the airport to go to the hotel and we paid for 02 people Eur40 instead of EUR10 that was the hotel offer. So, ask them to help you, don't try to bargain yourself in this case! Also if you are traveling through Gokcen (the farther airport in Anatolia) the hotel can help you with some cheap options of transport. The hotel and staff are super! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: pauer
Reviews.Content: Good experience @ Senatus Hotel Location: Well located for main tourist attractions in Sultanhamet. Pethaps too "touristy" location for those loking for more authenticity Rooms: Fantastic room: clean, well equipped and very comfortable. Breakfast: Wide variety of choice, good quality Staff: Extremely good attitude of all staff. Proactive in wanting to help and very attentive. They went above and beyond to make us feel welcome Overall: A+ experience

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay to enjoy Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: MJL999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate to choose the Senatus from the TripAdvisor site for our first trip to Istanbul. The hotel is on a wonderful street in the old part of the city. Lots of outdoor restaurants and near the major historic sites and also near the Sea of Marmara. The hotel is intimate, clean and modern. The staff is very helpful, especially Cagdas (Chadash) who helped us with restaurants and a boat tour of the Bosphorus. We would stay here again if ever in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Well located friendly staff great food”
Reviews.Author: dannyraza
Reviews.Content: Very well located,,even better staff..I traveled with small kids and the place was very near to bazaars , blue mosque,hagia Sofia and other place of interest..I use to walk all around those places with my 1.5 year daughter and her stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: DavidGHooper
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely perfect. from information pack the minute we booked the hotel, the reception, great staff, the room was perfect, lots of nice small touches, most comfortable bed ever. if you are looking for a small boutique hotel in istanbul then look no further. For breakfast, I would suggest asking for fresh coffee and tea. If what you want isn't on display (and the choice is fine) then just ask - it comes at no cost. The location for the tourist bits is perfect, loads of great bars and eateries just outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable & well-located. Mediocre service & food”
Reviews.Author: JD3734
Reviews.Content: Senatus provided quiet, comfortable, modern facilities in the very heart of the tourist district in Istanbul. The staff was professional and competent, but lacked the charm and enthusiastic helpfulness I had enjoyed in the other accommodations I stayed in Turkey. Senatus sits on a street that struck me as mini-Switzerland, "Disneyfied" version of Istanbul, lined with cute building facades and outdoor cafes catering strictly to tourists. I actually found the street quite pleasant and comfortable, but for those travelers who are aggressively striving for the authentic Istanbul experience, they may want to seek a hotel in another neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Istanbul-Stay in Senatus”
Reviews.Author: VickyDim
Reviews.Content: Senatus Hotel is an excellent choice which combines excellent service in a very good price. Located in Sultanahmet area, you can visit on foot not only the sight seeings as Ayia Sofia and Top Kapi and Blue Mosque, but you can also visit famous hamam places and you can visit the market around there. The people of the hotel are very helpful in giving all information you need and they assist you in anything that makes your accomodation better.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: GR_Travellers
Reviews.Content: A few days ago, my wife and I went on holiday to Istanbul. We chose our hotel via internet. We noticed that Senatus Hotel had a high ranking (#7) at tripadvisor, so we checked the reviews and the photos and we called them to make a reservation. We spoke on the telephone with them and they were extremely helpful and very illuminating about their hotel. So far the first impression was excellent. So we booked a room (â€œSenatorâ€�) for 4 nights. Due to an unexpected problem we were obliged to postpone our trip for about two weeks. We called the hotel and we requested cancellation of our reservation - this was done without any problem at all. When we called again after a few days for a new booking, they told us that there wasnâ€™t any room available for four consequent nights. As we definitely wanted to stay at Senatus Hotel, because they sounded so friendly during our first contact, we agreed to their proposal that we stay at the â€œImperatorâ€� (which was larger but a bit more expensive) room for three nights and then on the last night we could change to the â€œDominusâ€� (a slightly smaller room), for the same price that we had agreed on the first time. When we arrived at the hotel, the first impression was very good (and it was going to get betterâ€¦). Itâ€™s an attractive building situated in a semi-pedestrian road at a great location, 7 minutes away from two tram stations and in a walking distance from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topcapi. What can we say about the â€œImperatorâ€� (#407) room? Spacious (a good 30 m2), tastefully decorated, modern but with enough Turkish elements. Very clean, very bright, surprisingly sound-proofed and with all the modern comforts one can expect from a hotel of this category. The highlight of the room was the big painted glass that separates the room from the bathroom (you could choose to draw the blinds inside the bathroom for discretion). The bathroom itself was big and spotlessly clean, with high pressure water and a Jacuzzi tub (the only issue was the height of the fixed overhead â€œrainâ€� shower (I am 1,85 tall, so it was low for me -my wife is 1,70 but it was ok for her.) But there was an alternative hand shower, so everything was ok. Large closets, a safe and free wi-fi access completed the set. Overall impression: excellent! We couldnâ€™t have made a better choice. Excited as we were, we went to the reception (Selcuk and Umut were our men) and asked for some information about the city. Their English was perfect and we soon discovered they were fluent in other languages as well! They had a great sense of humor and they were more than willing to help us in any way. They were always ready to answer all our questions or get us information on how to move around. For example, we wanted to make a small trip to the suburbs of Istanbul and they very kindly printed all the boat and bus timetables, they contacted the Patriarchate for us and printed a multi-page list of orthodox churches. They were even willing to stay beyond their working hours until they were sure all problems had been solved! We almost felt that they had adopted us!!! We want to thank both Umut and Selcuk for making our trip so enjoyable. Breakfast was rich; everything that we tasted was of the best quality. The restaurant was nicely decorated with a good selection of classical music playing softly on the background, a flat TV showing (muted) Charlie Chaplin films and old Cartoons. It was always a pleasure seeing Habibâ€™s and Gozdeâ€™s smiling faces every morning. Finally, another good thing was that -for some reason- they charged us LESS(!!!) than what had been agreed. We returned to the airport with the hotelâ€™s transport service, with a gentle driver and soft classical music playing all the way. Would we recommend Senatus Hotel? ABSOLUTELY!!! PS. Some tips: -We think Sultanahmet is the best part of Istanbul to stay in; you can walk to all the main attractions or take the public transportation to visit the rest of the city. -Keep a pair of extra socks with you for use inside the mosques (at least thatâ€™s what we did). -Spring is a nice time to visit Istanbul. Tulips are everywhere and really beautiful. Greetings to all you guys at Senatus Hotel! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of good but some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Micah_Smith
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the shabby hotel lobby and corridors as the hotel has much to offer. Prices were good value but there were lots of other benefits. The location is fantastic and when you step out of the hotel in the evening the smells, sights and noise is enchanting. Blue Mosque etc are just round the corner and the staff are happy to give valuable advice. The restaurant hotel was really good value (you get a 15% discount) and staff are again friendly. Rooms are a bit on the small side and the views are of a back of another building but they were well equipped (free wifi) and quiet. We walked all over the 'old town' so the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “it's all in the details”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: i admit, i am torn about senatus. i chose it over the four seasons because it had better TA reviews and was a whole lot cheaper. the location is great, the styling inside the hotel is trendy. however, there was a lingering smell of cigarette smoke everywhere, and the bed was so flippin' hard. it was really uncomfortable, i must say. the bathroom is very tiny, but serviceable. wish they paid more attention to details, though, like bathroom ammenities (only dove soap attached to shower, no washcloths provided). i wasn't overly impressed with the housekeeping -- it was just not on par with other boutique hotels. i felt that housekeeping was very rushed, and not well done. general cleanliness was slightly sub-par. i didn't care too much for the breakfast, but they did have a variety of meats, cheeses, and some cereal. the restaurant itself wasn't very clean (lots of stains everywhere). and i didn't get the tom and jerry cartoons always playing. strange. breakfast staff wasn't overly pleasant, either. front desk staff was very nice, and very accomodating. they let us check in early and gave us free breakfast, which was very kind. so, all in all, i'm torn. would i recommend? i suppose so, but not with a "YOU MUST STAY HERE!!" more of a, if you can get it for really cheap (like we did), senatus is in a great location. just bring a feather bed with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly people”
Reviews.Author: yugobetrugo
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel great location. It was lovely spending the nights in the hotels cafeteria and talking to the people working there. I also like the design on the hotel in general quite modern and soothing. Almost perfekt hotel for my purpouse(clean hotel in the centrum with good service) other than that the beds could be slightly better but in general I could recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel! Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AlexOLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Senatus on a three night break, having walked in to try and find a room following a bad hotel elsewhere in Istanbul. I have to say that from the moment we walked through the door, and throughout our entire stay, we found the hotel to be first class. The staff were friendly, helpful, and cheerful, and could be approached easily. The rooms were really comfortable, clean and quiet, with lovely decor and spotless bathrooms. The food (both breakfast and evening meal) were superb. I really did struggle to find fault with this hotel, and would really highly recommend it! We had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to stay there again. Thank you Senatus for rescuing our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abletrop
Reviews.Content: Great location to be close to the action in "Old Town" Istanbul. Plenty of restaurants and sights to see within an easy walk. The beds are much better than average, the rooms are still new and although small, have everything you would expect. I have to say that my wife and I were more than satisfied with this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: JeffGold
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Turkey--which is fabulous--and had a great experience at the Senatus. The hotel is a botique, in the Sultan Ahmet neighborhood, and wonderfully located. Though you have to run the gauntlet of friendly carpet vendors and restaurant hawkers trying to interest you in their wares, it is a very short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and other astounding historical sites that my wife and I were absolutely blown away by. We had the deluxe room (actually the one pictured on the website), which i recommend if you can afford it--it's quite large, unlike some of the others we peeked into. The bed was excellent, the room SPOTLESS, everything new, and thought the decor won't be for everyone, we found it very comfortable. Cagdas, who manned the front desk most of the time, was very helpful and worked hard to find online resources for record stores, which I was interested in. The folks in the restaurant were wonderful too, and we had a blast watching Charlie Chaplin movies they seem to screen whenever they're open. We would definitely recommend the Senatus and Istanbul--an amazing city full of incredible culture, sights and superb food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MAXINEOxford
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent from emails confirming booking and requesting transfer from airport to this mornings check out. It is in an excellent position in Istanbul's old town, a five minute walk from the blue mosque and five minutes from the sea. There is a very good restaurant attached to the hotel where the food is not expensive and very tasty! The staff at the hotel are all friendly, always smiling and go out of their way to be helpful. We were offered a drink when we checked in and were given a drink after check out while we waited for our car to the airport. The rooms are large and very well appointed with everything you could need including free mineral water. We loved Istanbul and we loved the Senatus Hotel. Thank you to all the hotel and restaurant staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “WARMTH,HOSPITALITY AND UNIQUE LOCATION IN ADDITION TO EXTREMELY QUALIFIED STAFF”
Reviews.Author: oyalevo
Reviews.Content: During our stay at Senatus Hotel we really felt at home.The cosy atmosphere and the friendly staff, who are always available to serve, makes the Senatus distinctive among the boutique hotels in the area.Architectural features with holy motifs are really charming. You are never likely to be overcharcharged. We even didn't pay any for the extra bed and the delicious breakfast for three individuals,which was beyond our expectations. Although the rooms are not quite big, you can enjoy the comfort and the cleanliness as well as the high quality soaps which never dries your skin.As regars location,all the main tourist attractions are within easy reach of the hotel. Nightlife is not far away. For a tranquil stay in the heart of the metropolitan city, I highly reccommend Senatus to anybody who like holidaying for leisure or culture. I would like to thank to Ã‡aÄŸdaÅŸ TÃ¼rkoÄŸlu,Burak YÃ¼zbaÅŸ,Habip Ã‡evik and GÃ¶zde KadÄ±rgan for welcoming us warmly and sincerely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsRo
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a quiet area - perfect location for walking to all the main tourist sites. Very friendly and helpful staff who speak very good English. Rooms extremely comfortable and clean with all the necessary facilties you would expect - TV, tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar etc. Situated in a road with plenty of other restaurants and bars but hotel restaurant served such excellent food that we ate there every night. Excellent breakfast too with lovely bread. Really made our first trip to Istanbul great and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location, staff could not be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: RoderickandJane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, Rooms very clean and well equiped, maybe a little on the small side but had everything we needed. Location extremely good for the main sites to visit in Istanbul, no more than 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Staff extremely pleasant and could not be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location' location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyflorida1
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife generally take one or two holidays a year, and therefore spend a great deal of time while searcing the hotels on the Internet before booking. We haven't been to Istanbul before but it appeared, at first glance anyway, to have a lot in common with Paris which we have enjoyed so much. We use trip advisor a lot: so as soon as we saw that tyhe Senatus was listed as number 10 of all the hotels in Istanbul, it became our choice after digging a while. We found a good deal on its own website and went ahead with our booking. What a location! In the middle of the old city' just around the corner form the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia.... First impressions are so important, and so it was comforting to be greeted at the airport in a very friendly style. The ambience of the hotel was just super, no other word for it and the room itself "Dominus" was immaculate. A welcome wine greeted us and my wife was soon exploring the room facilities which included tea and coffee making facilities. During our week's stay we used Palato Cafe restaurant which belongs to the Senatus hotel and found it offering an excellent menu. The buffet breakfast was very satisfying and the waiter service was always more than adequate. Rooms were superbly clean, the satff was extremely kind and helpful. If you ask whether I 'll choose Senatus again. Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: janvier11
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport (Sahiba Gokcen -it's about an hour away) by the pre-arranged car from the hotel and right from the start were made to feel welcome. Ã‡aÄŸdaÅŸ TÃ¼rkoÄŸlu in reception was very helpful, especially as he gave us a room upgrade. Nothing was too much trouble. All the staff, particularly those in the restaurant, were charming and friendly. The rooms were clean and well serviced. Even though ours fronted the busy street we were not troubled by noise at night (but this was only January). The location is excellent as Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace are easy walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “JUST LIKE HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: nateo87
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the center of the center has just opened|! After travelling around Turkey, I can definatelly say that it's the best place to stay! convenient and NEW, with a sublime style. the personell is very very nice and helpfull!!! REALLY ADVICE TO GO AND HAVE A NICE AND RESTORING SLEEP IN SENATUS! BETTER THAN AT HOME

Reviews.Title: “5 star, 1st class, 0 complaints.”
Reviews.Author: toph61
Reviews.Content: We had never been to either Turkey or Istanbul before but had long held an attraction to go there as we considered there to be something quite mystical / magical about the place. That view partly derived from an assumption that it was a very basic place where life was lived in the raw and on the edge. To an extent that is true of Istanbul. But the people there? So friendly, so courteous, so absolutely charming. And the Senatus hotel no less so. The staff were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble and it was demonstrable that they wanted you to be comfortable and happy in every aspect of your visit and stay. All staff, without exception, were courteous, friendly and downright pleasant to spend time with. The hotel itself was beautful, extremely clean, excellent facilities and exceptionally good value for money. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: oldkafenion
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious rooms and very friendly staff, only a few steps away from the mayor touristical topics of old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: freespirit13
Reviews.Content: Situation is perfect, easy to walk anywhere within the old city and tramway to the other parts of the city is very close. Hotel: 9/10, very nice modern Turkish decoration, nice sized room, extremely clean and comfortable; very, very friendly and helpful staff who answers all your questions efficiently and with a smile, books limousine cars to airport, hammam, performance tickets, whatever...very good andwide selection for breakfast. Overall a real pleasure. Why 9/10? because you sometimes hear your neighbours a bit too much.

Reviews.Title: “Most hospitable hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sopamaggie
Reviews.Content: I joined Tripadvisor specifically to praise this hotel. I travel over 30% of the year for work and this is one of the best hotels that I've ever stayed in. The rooms are immaculate and the employees went above and beyond my expectations. I arrived to the hotel at 7am and while it was too early for me to check in, they invited me to have partake in the complimentary breakfast. (which was wonderful) On my last day my flight didn't leave until much the evening, and they suggested (they suggested) that I just check out that evening since the hotel wasn't full and nobody would be using my room anyhow. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here every time that i am in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sultanahmet base”
Reviews.Author: Shmoofest
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Istanbul, and the staff at this new boutique hotel (less than a year old) welcomed us like family. Our room was one of the "Dominus" rooms, and as such was quite spacious. Bathroom had whirlpool tub. Everything was spotless. Our window opened onto the bustling street below, but when closed couldn't hear a peep! The included Turkish breakfast buffet in the attached restaurant was excellent, and large enough that we could skip lunch in a pinch (not recommended in this city of food!) We can't wait to get back to Istanbul, and we will definitely stay at the Senatus again. Reading over my review it sounds like a fake. It's not! Just to prove it, I'll say that the hallways were a bit stuffy and airless.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: JacoBerco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days at the Senatus Hotel and my experience was fantastic..! Rooms are nicely decorated, nice queen bed, and clean. Eventhough, rooms are not big in size they are well distributed. Breakfast is included, with some variety of things to choose from. Senatus, is located in Sutanahmet, and that's where you want to be to start exploring Istambul. Literaly, foot steps to restaurants that you can choose from. Walking distance (5 min) to the main attractions like The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern. If you choose to go to the Grand Bazaar, either you can walk or take the tram which is only 5 min away. The staff at the front desk are very courteous and willing to help you in any way. Thanks to the other reviews, I was able to choose this gem of a boutique hotel. I highly recommed the Senatus.

Reviews.Title: “location not luxury”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehomegirl
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly pleasant little place - but nothing much more than that. With its undeniably great location, one of the standard rooms represents good value for money. The Imperator room is more pricey and then the experience is a bit lacking for the price. In my opinion it is not one thing or another - lacks the style of a boutique hotel, the charm of a B&B, the efficiency of a mainstream hotel. So for example on arrival reception (which is a hallway with a desk) was empty and remained so for quite a while until we went & sought out a member of staff; the promised wine & fruit basket in the room never appeared; the spa bath did not spa; there are no toiletries; the complimentary mineral water is a single bottle on arrival and is not replenished; sheets and towels are replaced only every three days (with no simple system for getting clean towels if you need then before); the furniture (whilst new) is rather flimsy. Just the small touches that detract from the experience. Howvever for a small standard room in a great location in a hassle free hotel then this is good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chalkie560
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while on a business trip, very clean room hotel, great location, small and very friendly, be assured next trip to Istanbul I'll be booking a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: katrinabull
Reviews.Content: I had just one evening in Istanbul before heading off to Kayseri at 6am the next morning. This hotel was clean, lovely glamourous room, great shower, friendly staff. The location was in walking distance of the historic part and so I made maximum use of my 3 hours in the city. They have a taxi to the airport, reasonable charge of 50euros, can't quite remember. But, the point of my trip was to see some of the city and get a good, if short, nights sleep - which I did. Thankyou Senatus. I have booked the Millenium Suites but this is the sister hotel next door, which was really lovely. It's be nice to take the husband next time, and not have to leave so early for a meeting!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sheridanjr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Senatus Hotel for seven nights. You have a lot of options while staying in Istanbul but we were lucky to have picked this hotel. The staff was friendly, professional, and willing to help you enjoy their beautiful city. The room was clean, quiet, and nicely decorated. The one thing that we loved about this boutique hotel was the location--centrally located near tons of restaurants, shops, and sites (walked by the Blue mosque every day!). Also, the breakfast was very good (especially the rolls, fresh fruit, and juice). All and all we would highly recommend staying at this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Turkish hospitality, very nice decor, terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: CowSong
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Senatus - we were there for five nights and were disappointed to leave! The rooms are generously sized, well thought out in decor, great qualty, fantastic staff...Cagdas and Selcuk, the desk staff, were superb and Umut the manager made us feel welcome and all were very attentive. Walking distance to major sites - Blue Mosque, Topkapi, trams to Spice Bazaar. They have created a really nice boutique hotel -- we will definitely come back! Be sure to try the sauna....ahhhh!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFugett
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start... This is an amazing hotel. Great service, good food and friendly staff in a prime location. If you have dinner here the lamb shank is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Deisgner Room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: spaceman000
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by another which had no rooms available for the last three days of our holiday, and we didnt have a moment of regret. The hotel 's almost brand new, and it shows in the lovely rooms with the designer baths, and the view... overlooking the main street, was awesome. Stick your head out, and you could practically touch any table in half a dozen outdoor cafes, and the flavours and sounds of the street waft through the air, and envelop you as if you are inches away. The location of the hotel is again superb, we were able to walk to practically every heritage and historical site in old Istanbul (Sultanahmet) and we could not ask for anything more than that. I recommend this hotel very highly indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Senatus is the perfect launching pad for sight seeing in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: ollieboog
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived after an overseas flight from New York, we were exhausted as we checked in to the Hotel Senatus. Two delightful young men were working at the front desk (the one I liked the best has a name that's pronounced Chadash) and efficiently oriented us to their cozy little hotel. The sparkling clean room I entered was a welcome sight and in particular the bed which was covered in crisp, white linens. While European beds tend to be much firmer than Americans are used to, this one was relatively comfortable (no pillow-top, mind you, but the mattress did have a little give to it.) Bottom line, I felt like I was in a very nice establishment where high standards are maintained. Oh, the bathroom, was also wonderful. Sophisticated looking with a wonderful shower. The restaurant for breakfast was nothing fancy but nice and clean with helpful wait staff. Eggs, sausage, assorted breads, fruit and cheeses are included and are presented in an appealing way. I particularly enjoyed getting to sit at tables next to a wall of windows that look out on the charming street which is narrow but always bustling with activity. Hotel Senatus is a pleasant walk from all the main tourist attractions and if you want to go somewhere beyond Sultanhamet (the neighborhood,) the tram is user-friendly although sometimes pretty darn crowded. One last thing - the in-room wireless internet worked perfectly and was free. Since I was traveling with friends and away from my family, it was so nice to be able to come back to my room at night and communicate online with everyone back home.

Reviews.Title: “a dream boutique hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lavi48
Reviews.Content: we just got back from 24 days in turkey we book senatus from the 23 sept till the 29 sept the hotel was incredible location in the old distric staff very helpfull specially selguk vardar at the reception . we were pick up at the airport by private driver . the room was a superior room but also the regular room are very nice just a bit smaller and no jacuzzi. the breakfast are include and very nice. the reception people speak very well english also the manager speak french and he is also very helpfull. We enjoy are stay that on are return we book 3 nights from the 16 oct till the 19 oct and it was has good. i would recommend that hotel to any of my friends . claude

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: jade76_2010
Reviews.Content: We married in Istanbul in Septemberand chose Senatus Hotel as base for us and our guests. We contacted the hotel having read the recommendation of "The Little Hotel Book" and were convinced by the professional and hospitable communication. We booked the Palato Restaurant for a welcome cocktail and dinner reception for our guests the night before our wedding. The organisation and service of the event was impeccable.
